channel.title: Semi-Supervised Learning on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Semi-Supervised Learning on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Analysis of Corrected Graph Convolutions
item.description: Corrected graph convolutions prevent oversmoothing and exponentially improve GNN classification accuracy.

item.title: AUC Maximization under Positive Distribution Shift
item.description: New method maximizes AUC under positive distribution shift using only positive and unlabeled training data, and unlabeled test data; improving imbalanced classification.

item.title: Boosting Semi-Supervised Scene Text Recognition via Viewing and Summarizing
item.description: ViSu boosts semi-supervised scene text recognition by using an online generation strategy for diverse synthetic data and a novel character alignment loss to improve model generalization and robustness…

item.title: Continuous Contrastive Learning for Long-Tailed Semi-Supervised Recognition
item.description: CCL, a novel probabilistic framework, uses continuous contrastive learning to excel in long-tailed semi-supervised recognition, surpassing prior state-of-the-art methods by over 4%.

item.title: Continuous Partitioning for Graph-Based Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: CutSSL: a novel framework for graph-based semi-supervised learning, surpasses state-of-the-art accuracy by solving a continuous nonconvex quadratic program that provably yields integer solutions, exce…

item.title: Data Augmentation with Diffusion for Open-Set Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Boosting semi-supervised learning, a new data augmentation method using diffusion models significantly improves model accuracy, especially with mismatched data distributions.

item.title: DFA-GNN: Forward Learning of Graph Neural Networks by Direct Feedback Alignment
item.description: DFA-GNN: A novel forward learning framework for GNNs enhances training efficiency and robustness by directly aligning feedback signals, outperforming traditional methods.

item.title: Enhancing Semi-Supervised Learning via Representative and Diverse Sample Selection
item.description: RDSS: a novel sample selection method for semi-supervised learning, boosts model accuracy by minimizing a-MMD, striking a balance between sample representativeness and diversity.

item.title: Generative Semi-supervised Graph Anomaly Detection
item.description: GGAD: Generative Semi-supervised Graph Anomaly Detection significantly outperforms existing methods by using a novel approach to generate pseudo-anomaly nodes for training, leveraging asymmetric local…

item.title: Graph Neural Networks Do Not Always Oversmooth
item.description: Deep graph neural networks often suffer from oversmoothing; this paper reveals a non-oversmoothing phase controllable by weight variance, enabling deep, expressive models.

item.title: HGDL: Heterogeneous Graph Label Distribution Learning
item.description: HGDL: Heterogeneous Graph Label Distribution Learning, a new framework that leverages graph topology and content to enhance label distribution prediction.

item.title: Imprecise Label Learning: A Unified Framework for Learning with Various Imprecise Label Configurations
item.description: Unified framework for imprecise label learning handles noisy, partial, and semi-supervised data, improving model training efficiency and accuracy.

item.title: Improving self-training under distribution shifts via anchored confidence with theoretical guarantees
item.description: Anchored Confidence (AnCon) significantly improves self-training under distribution shifts by using a temporal ensemble to smooth noisy pseudo-labels, achieving 8-16% performance gains without computa…

item.title: Instructor-inspired Machine Learning for Robust Molecular Property Prediction
item.description: InstructMol, a novel semi-supervised learning algorithm, leverages unlabeled data and an instructor model to significantly improve the accuracy and robustness of molecular property prediction, even wi…

item.title: IntraMix: Intra-Class Mixup Generation for Accurate Labels and Neighbors
item.description: IntraMix: Boost GNN accuracy by cleverly generating high-quality labels and enriching node neighborhoods using intra-class Mixup.

item.title: Label Noise: Ignorance Is Bliss
item.description: Ignorance is bliss: A new framework shows ignoring label noise in multi-class classification can achieve state-of-the-art performance, especially when using self-supervised feature extraction.

item.title: Learning from Noisy Labels via Conditional Distributionally Robust Optimization
item.description: This paper introduces AdaptCDRP, a novel algorithm that uses conditional distributionally robust optimization to build robust classifiers from noisy labels, achieving superior accuracy.

item.title: Learning on Large Graphs using Intersecting Communities
item.description: Learn on massive graphs efficiently using Intersecting Community Graphs (ICGs)! This method approximates large graphs with ICGs, enabling linear time/memory complexity for node classification.

item.title: Learning the Latent Causal Structure for Modeling Label Noise
item.description: Learning latent causal structures improves label noise modeling by accurately estimating noise transition matrices without relying on similarity-based assumptions, leading to state-of-the-art classifi…

item.title: Multi-Instance Partial-Label Learning with Margin Adjustment
item.description: MIPLMA, a novel algorithm, enhances multi-instance partial-label learning by dynamically adjusting margins for attention scores and predicted probabilities, leading to superior performance.

item.title: OwMatch: Conditional Self-Labeling with Consistency for Open-world Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: OwMatch: a novel framework conquering open-world semi-supervised learning challenges by combining conditional self-labeling and consistency for substantially enhanced accuracy across known and unknown…

item.title: Pearls from Pebbles: Improved Confidence Functions for Auto-labeling
item.description: Colander: a novel auto-labeling technique boosts data efficiency by 60%, optimizing confidence functions for maximum coverage with minimal error.

item.title: Persistence Homology Distillation for Semi-supervised Continual Learning
item.description: Persistence Homology Distillation (PsHD) leverages topological data analysis to robustly preserve structural information in semi-supervised continual learning, significantly outperforming existing met…

item.title: RankUp: Boosting Semi-Supervised Regression with an Auxiliary Ranking Classifier
item.description: RankUp: Revolutionizing semi-supervised regression by cleverly adapting classification techniques for superior performance!

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Guided Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Reinforcement Learning guides a novel semi-supervised learning method, improving model performance by adaptively balancing labeled and unlabeled data.

item.title: Revisiting Score Propagation in Graph Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: GRASP: A novel graph augmentation strategy boosts OOD node detection by strategically adding edges to enhance the intra-edge ratio, addressing score propagation’s limitations in various scenarios.

item.title: S-MolSearch: 3D Semi-supervised Contrastive Learning for Bioactive Molecule Search
item.description: S-MolSearch: a novel semi-supervised framework using 3D molecular data and contrastive learning achieves state-of-the-art in bioactive molecule search, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Semi-supervised Knowledge Transfer Across Multi-omic Single-cell Data
item.description: DANCE, a novel semi-supervised framework, efficiently transfers cell types across multi-omic single-cell data even with limited labeled samples, outperforming current state-of-the-art methods.

item.title: Semi-supervised Multi-label Learning with Balanced Binary Angular Margin Loss
item.description: S2ML2-BBAM: A new semi-supervised multi-label learning method that balances feature angle distributions to improve accuracy and fairness.

item.title: Semi-Supervised Sparse Gaussian Classification: Provable Benefits of Unlabeled Data
item.description: This study proves that combining labeled and unlabeled data significantly improves high-dimensional sparse Gaussian classification, offering a polynomial-time SSL algorithm that outperforms supervised…

item.title: Similarity-Navigated Conformal Prediction for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: SNAPS: a novel algorithm boosts graph neural network accuracy by efficiently aggregating non-conformity scores, improving prediction sets without sacrificing validity.

item.title: SpeAr: A Spectral Approach for Zero-Shot Node Classification
item.description: SpeAr: A novel spectral approach significantly improves zero-shot node classification by using inherent graph structure to reduce prediction bias and effectively identifying unseen node classes.

item.title: Task-Agnostic Machine-Learning-Assisted Inference
item.description: PSPS: a novel task-agnostic framework enables valid and efficient ML-assisted statistical inference for virtually any task, simply using summary statistics from existing analysis routines!

item.title: Weak Supervision Performance Evaluation via Partial Identification
item.description: This paper introduces a novel method for evaluating weakly supervised models using Fréchet bounds, providing reliable performance bounds without ground truth labels.

item.title: What Makes Partial-Label Learning Algorithms Effective?
item.description: Unlocking Partial-Label Learning: A new study reveals surprisingly simple design principles for highly accurate algorithms, dramatically simplifying future research and boosting performance.
